org.teatrove.trove.util
Class DecimalConvertor

java.lang.Object
  org.teatrove.trove.util.DecimalConvertor

public class DecimalConvertor
extends Object

Accurately converts floating point numbers to decimal digits. The core functions implement the Fixed-Precision Positive Floating-Point Printout algorithm presented in "How to Print Floating-Point Numbers Accurately" by Guy L. Steele Jr and Jon L White.

Version:
Author:
Brian S O'Neill

          Mutable large unsigned integer class, similar to BigInteger, but specialized.

Field Detail

ROUND_HALF_UP

public static final int ROUND_HALF_UP
Rounding mode that rounds up if the remainder is 1/2 or more. This rounding mode is more exact than ROUND_HALF_UP_DECIMAL, but it may display unexpected results.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ROUND_HALF_UP_DECIMAL

public static final int ROUND_HALF_UP_DECIMAL
When using this rounding mode, an additional decimal digit may be produced. If this digit is 5 or more, the number is rounded up. The additional digit is discarded. Although the produced number is less exact than ROUND_HALF_UP, it is more like what a user would expect. For example, 6.35 when converted to 2 digits is 6.4. With ROUND_HALF_UP, the digits are 6.3. This is because the exact binary floating point value is slightly less than 6.35.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DecimalConvertor

public DecimalConvertor()
Method Detail

format

public static void format(float v,
                          StringBuffer buf)
Formats a floating point value like Float.toString, except values are never formatted in scientific notation.

Parameters:
v - value
buf - buffer to receive formatted number
maxDigits - maximum number of digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce

format

public static void format(float v,
                          StringBuffer buf,
                          int maxDigits,
                          int maxFractDigits,
                          int roundMode,
                          int minWholeDigits,
                          int minFractDigits,
                          char minusSymbol,
                          char plusSymbol,
                          char decimalSeparator,
                          int decimalScale,
                          char groupingSeparator,
                          int groupingWidth,
                          String infinity,
                          String nan)
Parameters:
v - value
buf - buffer to receive formatted number
maxDigits - maximum number of manstissa digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce
roundMode - i.e. ROUND_HALF_UP
minWholeDigits - minimum number of whole digits to produce
minFractDigits - minimum number of fractional digits to produce
minusSymbol - i.e. '-' or '￿' for none
plusSymbol - i.e. '+' or '￿' for none
decimalSeparator - i.e. '.'
decimalScale - i.e. 0 for none or 2 for percentages
groupingSeparator - i.e. ',' or '￿' for none
groupingWidth - i.e. 3 or 0 for none
infinity - i.e. "Infinity" or "∞"
nan - i.e. "NaN" or "�"

decimal exponent

toDecimalDigits

public static int toDecimalDigits(float v,
                                  char[] digits,
                                  int offset,
                                  int maxDigits,
                                  int maxFractDigits,
                                  int roundMode)
Produces decimal digits for non-zero, finite floating point values. The sign of the value is discarded. Passing in Infinity or NaN produces invalid digits. The maximum number of decimal digits that this function will likely produce is 9.

Parameters:
v - value
digits - buffer to receive decimal digits
offset - offset into digit buffer
maxDigits - maximum number of digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce
roundMode - i.e. ROUND_HALF_UP
Returns:
Upper 16 bits: decimal point offset; lower 16 bits: number of digits produced

toDecimalDigits

public static int toDecimalDigits(double v,
                                  char[] digits,
                                  int offset,
                                  int maxDigits,
                                  int maxFractDigits,
                                  int roundMode)
Produces decimal digits for non-zero, finite floating point values. The sign of the value is discarded. Passing in Infinity or NaN produces invalid digits. The maximum number of decimal digits that this function will likely produce is 18.

Parameters:
v - value
digits - buffer to receive decimal digits
offset - offset into digit buffer
maxDigits - maximum number of digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce
roundMode - i.e. ROUND_HALF_UP
Returns:
Upper 16 bits: decimal point offset; lower 16 bits: number of digits produced

toDecimalDigits

public static int toDecimalDigits(int f,
                                  int e,
                                  int p,
                                  char[] digits,
                                  int offset,
                                  int maxDigits,
                                  int maxFractDigits,
                                  int roundMode)
Produces decimal digits for binary floating point values greater than zero.

Parameters:
f - floating point mantissa
e - floating point exponent
p - floating point precision (number of bits)
digits - buffer to receive decimal digits
offset - offset into digit buffer
maxDigits - maximum number of digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce
roundMode - i.e. ROUND_HALF_UP
Returns:
Upper 16 bits: decimal point offset; lower 16 bits: number of digits produced

toDecimalDigits

public static int toDecimalDigits(DecimalConvertor.LargeUInt f,
                                  int e,
                                  int p,
                                  char[] digits,
                                  int offset,
                                  int maxDigits,
                                  int maxFractDigits,
                                  int roundMode)
Produces decimal digits for binary floating point values greater than zero.

Parameters:
f - floating point mantissa (value is destroyed)
e - floating point exponent
p - floating point precision (number of bits)
digits - buffer to receive decimal digits
offset - offset into digit buffer
maxDigits - maximum number of digits to produce
maxFractDigits - maximum number of fractional digits to produce
roundMode - i.e. ROUND_HALF_UP
Returns:
Upper 16 bits: decimal point offset; lower 16 bits: number of digits produced
